About This Passphrase Generator

← Back to Generator

Security Features

  • Maximum Security: 20 words = 258.5 bits of entropy
  • Cryptographically Secure: Uses Web Crypto API for true randomness
  • No Tracking: Completely private, no data collection
  • Open Source: All code is visible and auditable
  • EFF Word List: 7,776 carefully selected words
  • Offline-First: Works without internet connection
  • Uncrackable: Would take longer than the age of the universe to crack

Security Metrics

Entropy:258.5 bits
Possible combinations:7.59 × 10⁷⁷
Time to crack (1 billion/sec):1.2 × 10⁶¹ years (trillions of times the age of universe)

How It Works

This generator uses the EFF's diceware method with their long wordlist of 7,776 words. Each word provides 12.925 bits of entropy (log₂(7776)).

With 20 words, you get 258.5 bits of entropy, making it computationally infeasible to crack even with quantum computers.

The randomness comes from your browser's cryptographically secure random number generator (crypto.getRandomValues), not from weak Math.random().

Why 20 Words?

While 6-8 words provide adequate security for most purposes, 20 words ensures:

  • Protection against future advances in computing power
  • Resistance to quantum computing attacks
  • Peace of mind for the most security-conscious users
  • A passphrase that will remain secure for decades

Privacy

This tool runs entirely in your browser. No data is ever sent to any server. There are no analytics, no tracking pixels, no cookies, and no third-party resources.

Each passphrase is generated using true randomness and cannot be reproduced. We don't store, log, or have any way to know what passphrase you generate.
